20110105020028.000|20110105020029.000|CC1|A.M. IN TOKYO.                  
20110105020029.000|20110105020031.000|CC1|I'M CATHERINE KOBAYASHI.        
20110105020031.000|20110105020033.000|CC1|JAPANESE FOREIGN MINISTER SEIJI 
20110105020033.000|20110105020034.000|CC1|MAEHARA SAYS HE HOPES AN        
20110105020034.000|20110105020036.000|CC1|ENVIRONMENT CAN BE CREATED FOR  
20110105020036.000|20110105020037.000|CC1|BILATERAL TALKS WITH NORTH KOREA
20110105020037.000|20110105020039.000|CC1|TO DISCUSS ITS ABDUCTIONS OF    
20110105020039.000|20110105020040.000|CC1|JAPANESE NATIONALS AS WELL AS   
20110105020040.000|20110105020041.000|CC1|ITS MISSILE AND NUCLEAR         
20110105020041.000|20110105020043.000|CC1|DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM.            
20110105020043.000|20110105020045.000|CC1|SPEAKING AT A NEWS CONFERENCE ON
20110105020045.000|20110105020047.000|CC1|TUESDAY, MAEHARA COMMENTED ON A 
20110105020047.000|20110105020049.000|CC1|NEW YEAR EDITORIAL PUBLISHED    
20110105020049.000|20110105020051.000|CC1|JOINTLY BY THREE NORTH KOREAN   
20110105020051.000|20110105020051.000|CC1|NEWSPAPERS.                     
20110105020051.000|20110105020053.000|CC1|IT CALLED FOR DIALOGUE WITH     
20110105020053.000|20110105020055.000|CC1|SOUTH KOREA TO REDUCE           
20110105020055.000|20110105020056.000|CC1|NORTH/SOUTH TENSIONS.           
20110105020056.000|20110105020058.000|CC1|MAEHARA SAID ONE OF HIS         
20110105020058.000|20110105020058.000|CC1|GOVERNMENT'S AIMS THIS YEAR IS  
20110105020058.000|20110105020100.000|CC1|TO CREATE THE CONDITIONS THAT   
20110105020100.000|20110105020101.000|CC1|CAN LEAD TO DIRECT BILATERAL    
20110105020101.000|20110105020104.000|CC1|TALKS WITH NORTH KOREA.         
20110105020104.000|20110105020106.000|CC1|HE SIDE THE ISSUE OF JAPANESE   
20110105020106.000|20110105020107.000|CC1|NATIONALS ABDUCTED TO NORTH     
20110105020107.000|20110105020112.000|CC1|KOREA IS A VIOLATION OF JAPAN'S 
20110105020112.000|20110105020117.000|CC1|SOVEREIGNTY.                    
20110105020117.000|20110105020119.000|CC1|>> Translator: JAPAN SHOULD NOT 
20110105020119.000|20110105020121.000|CC1|COUNT ON NEGOTIATIONS HELD IN   
20110105020121.000|20110105020123.000|CC1|MULTILATERAL FORUMS SUCH AS THE 
20110105020123.000|20110105020123.000|CC1|SIX-PARTY TALKS.                
20110105020123.000|20110105020125.000|CC1|IT IS IMPORTANT TO CREATE THE   
20110105020125.000|20110105020126.000|CC1|RIGHT ATMOSPHERE SO BILATERAL   
20110105020126.000|20110105020128.000|CC1|TALKS CAN BE HELD ON ALL        
20110105020128.000|20110105020132.000|CC1|OUTSTANDING ISSUES.             
20110105020132.000|20110105020135.000|CC1|>> HOWEVER, MAEHARA ALSO        
20110105020135.000|20110105020136.000|CC1|EXPRESSED HIS RESERVATIONS.     
20110105020136.000|20110105020137.000|CC1|HE POINTED OUT IN JANUARY OF    
20110105020137.000|20110105020139.000|CC1|LAST YEAR NORTH KOREA ALSO      
20110105020139.000|20110105020140.000|CC1|ISSUED A JOINT EDITORIAL THAT   
20110105020140.000|20110105020143.000|CC1|HAD A MILD TONE BUT LATER       
20110105020143.000|20110105020146.000|CC1|CONTINUED WITH ITS URANIUIM     
20110105020146.000|20110105020147.000|CC1|ENRICHMENT, SANK A SOUTH KOREAN 
20110105020147.000|20110105020149.000|CC1|NAVAL PATROL SHIP, AND LAUNCHED 
20110105020149.000|20110105020151.000|CC1|AN ARTILLERY ATTACK ON SOUTH    
20110105020151.000|20110105020152.000|CC1|KOREA'S YEON-PYEONG ISLAND.     
20110105020152.000|20110105020154.000|CC1|MAEHARA STRESSED CAREFUL        
20110105020154.000|20110105020157.000|CC1|CONSIDERATION MUST BE GIVEN TO  
20110105020157.000|20110105020158.000|CC1|CHINA'S PROPOSAL FOR AN

20110105020204.000|20110105020206.000|CC1|DEALING WITH THE NORTH TO

20110105020503.000|20110105020604.000|SEG|Type=Story
20110105020503.000|20110105020505.000|CC1|>>> THE MINUTES OF THE FEDERAL  
20110105020505.000|20110105020507.000|CC1|RESERVE MEETING OF THE U.S. SHOW
20110105020507.000|20110105020510.000|CC1|POLICYMAKERS AGREED TO EXTEND   
20110105020510.000|20110105020511.000|CC1|ADDITIONAL CREDIT EASING        
20110105020511.000|20110105020513.000|CC1|MEASURES AMID A PERSISTENTLY    
20110105020513.000|20110105020516.000|CC1|HIGH JOBLESS RATE.              
20110105020516.000|20110105020517.000|CC1|CRITICISM WAS RAISED THAT IT    
20110105020517.000|20110105020518.000|CC1|COULD LEAD TO HIGHER INTEREST   
20110105020518.000|20110105020519.000|CC1|RATES WHICH COULD DELAY THE     
20110105020519.000|20110105020521.000|CC1|RECOVERY OF THE HOUSING MARKET. 
20110105020521.000|20110105020523.000|CC1|CRITICS ALSO SAY FURTHER EASING 
20110105020523.000|20110105020524.000|CC1|MAY CAUSE MORE INFLATION THAN   
20110105020524.000|20110105020525.000|CC1|NECESSARY BUT THE MINUTES FROM  
20110105020525.000|20110105020527.000|CC1|THE DECEMBER 14th MEETING       
20110105020527.000|20110105020530.000|CC1|RELEASED ON MONDAY SHOW THAT THE
20110105020530.000|20110105020531.000|CC1|AGREEMENT WAS REACHED AS RISKS  
20110105020531.000|20110105020532.000|CC1|OUTWEIGH THE POSSIBILITY THAT   
20110105020532.000|20110105020534.000|CC1|THE U.S. ECONOMIC RECOVERY COULD
20110105020534.000|20110105020536.000|CC1|PICK UP ITS PACE, THANKS TO     
20110105020536.000|20110105020538.000|CC1|RISING CONSUMER SPENDING.       
20110105020538.000|20110105020539.000|CC1|THE RISKS INCLUDE A WORSENING OF
20110105020539.000|20110105020542.000|CC1|THE HOUSING MARKET DUE TO       
20110105020542.000|20110105020543.000|CC1|CONTINUED HIGH UNEMPLOYMENT.    
20110105020543.000|20110105020544.000|CC1|STATE AND CITY GOVERNMENTS MAY  
20110105020544.000|20110105020547.000|CC1|CUT SPENDING OR RAISE TAXES DUE 
20110105020547.000|20110105020549.000|CC1|TO DETERIORATING FISCAL HEALTH. 
20110105020549.000|20110105020550.000|CC1|THE EUROPEAN DEBT PROBLEM MAY   
20110105020550.000|20110105020553.000|CC1|ALSO NEGATIVELY IMPACT THE U.S. 
20110105020553.000|20110105020553.000|CC1|ECONOMY.

20110105020555.000|20110105020556.000|CC1|LONG-TERM INTEREST RATES ROSE   
20110105020556.000|20110105020559.000|CC1|DUE TO AN IMPROVING ECONOMIC    
20110105020559.000|20110105020601.000|CC1|OUTLOOK AND BECAUSE THE FED'S   
20110105020601.000|20110105020602.000|CC1|ADDITIONAL EASING FELL BELOW    
20110105020602.000|20110105020604.000|CC1|MARKET EXPECTATIONS.

20110105020716.000|20110105020717.000|CC1|FURTHER AS A POSITIVE TREND IN

20110105020723.000|20110105020725.000|CC1|IF THAT RECOVERY IS ON TRACK.

20110105020727.000|20110105020729.000|CC1|ORDERS IN THE U.S., WHICH ALSO  
20110105020729.000|20110105020730.000|CC1|SUPPORTED THE DOLLAR.           
20110105020730.000|20110105020733.000|CC1|BUT ALSO THE OVERALL DOLLAR     
20110105020733.000|20110105020736.000|CC1|STRENGTH HELPED PUSH DOWN DOLLAR
20110105020736.000|20110105020737.000|CC1|DENOMINATED COMMODITIES AND THAT
20110105020737.000|20110105020739.000|CC1|WAS SUCH AS THE METAL SECTOR AND
20110105020739.000|20110105020741.000|CC1|GOLD WAS THE BIGGEST DECLINER   
20110105020741.000|20110105020743.000|CC1|FALLING AROUND 3%, ITS BIGGEST  
20110105020743.000|20110105020744.000|CC1|FALL SINCE JULY.                
20110105020744.000|20110105020746.000|CC1|ANALYSTS SUGGEST SOME OF THE    
20110105020746.000|20110105020748.000|CC1|FALL IN GOLD HOWEVER MAY ALSO BE
20110105020748.000|20110105020750.000|CC1|DOWN A CORRECTION OF SORTS AFTER
20110105020750.000|20110105020754.000|CC1|WE DID SEE IT GAINING AROUND 30%
20110105020754.000|20110105020756.000|CC1|IN 2010 AND ANALYSTS SAYING     
20110105020756.000|20110105020757.000|CC1|HEDGE FUND MANAGERS AND         
20110105020757.000|20110105020800.000|CC1|PORTFOLIO MANAGERS MAY BE JUST  
20110105020800.000|20110105020803.000|CC1|RE-ADJUSTING THEIR ASSETS       
20110105020803.000|20110105020804.000|CC1|WEIGHTINGS AT THE BEGINNING OF  
20110105020804.000|20110105020804.000|CC1|THE YEAR.

20110105022636.000|20110105022636.000|CC1|STATEMENT.

20110105022716.000|20110105022717.000|CC1|CAPITAL ISLAMABAD WHILE GETTING 
20110105022717.000|20110105022718.000|CC1|INTO HIS CAR.
